channel.title: [Pi] Dclaws
channel.description: Hey guys, does anybody have the D Claw spec animation file for Pi? The animation 6000 doesn't work right on my server. It'd be great if someone could help me out! Thanks!

item.title: [Pi] Dclaws
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Loveandpower:

gets toms suite, export animation 6000 out of another cache, import into yours?

It would be in main_file_cache.idk1 correct? If so, it didn’t work. Still does the same animation.

Read full topic

gets toms suite, export animation 6000 out of another cache, import into yours?

item.title: [Pi] Dclaws
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:3, topic:523121”]http://www.mediafire.com/download/ykzzzl24mjg/Dragon+Claw+Models.rar

if(i == 11740) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); }

If you have 474 cache - you should have the animation already. Make sure the animation isn’t being used by another item in the client.[/quote]

I have the model, and ints. I just don’t have the animation. When I do the spec it isn’t the right animation and when I do ::animation 6000 it does the same animation that the claws do. It’s like a nulled emote. It just makes the character look messed up.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Dclaws
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

MediaFire

Dragon Claw Models.rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.

if(i == 11740) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); }

If you have 474 cache - you should have the animation already. Make sure the animation isn’t being used by another item in the client.

Read full topic
